SEARCH
Module se1.bestellsystem
Package datamodel

Class DataFactory

Object
DataFactory
public class DataFactory extends Object
Factory class with create()-methods to instantiate objects of classes of the datamodel package from validated parameters. Objects are only created from valid parameters (e.g. names, email or phone contacts).
DataFactory itself exists as a ("lazy") singleton instance.
Version:
"D12-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT"
Author:
"sgraupner"

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static DataFactory getInstance()
      Static accessor method to DataFactory Singleton instance.
      Returns:
      singleton DataFactory instance

    • createCustomer

      public Optional<Customer> createCustomer(String name, String contact)
      Factory method to create an object of class Customer from validated parameters. The id attribute is internally provided. No object is created when arguments are not valid.
      Parameters:
      name - single-String name parameter, invalid if null or empty, example: "Eric Meyer" or "Meyer, Eric"
      contact - contact parameter validated as an email address containing '@' or a phone number, invalid if null or empty
      Returns:
      created Customer object with valid parameters or empty

    • createArticle

      public Optional<Article> createArticle(String description, long unitPrice, Pricing.PricingCategory pricingCategory, Pricing.TAXRate... taxRate)
      Factory method to create an object of class Article from validated arguments. The id attribute is internally provided. No object is created when arguments are not valid.
      Parameters:
      description - brief article description, e.g. "Tasse"
      unitPrice - price of one unit (in cent)
      pricingCategory - pricing table associated with this article
      taxRate - rate according to Pricing.TAXRate (TAXRate.Regular is default)
      Returns:
      Article object created from valid arguments or empty

    • createOrder

      public Optional<Order> createOrder(Optional<Customer> customer, Consumer<Order> orderConsumer)
      Factory method to create an object of class Order from validated arguments. The id attribute is internally provided. No object is created when arguments are not valid.
      Parameters:
      customer - owner of the order (foreign-key relaion)
      orderConsumer - accessor function called on the created object
      Returns:
      Order object created from valid arguments or empty

    • createOrder

      public Optional<Order> createOrder(Pricing.PricingCategory category, Optional<Customer> customer, Consumer<Order> orderConsumer)
      Factory method to create an object of class Order from validated arguments. The id attribute is internally provided. No object is created when arguments are not valid.
      Parameters:
      category - pricing category that applies to Order
      customer - owner of the order (foreign-key relaion)
      orderConsumer - accessor function called on the created object
      Returns:
      Order object created from valid arguments or empty

    • validateOrderCreationDate

      public Optional<LocalDateTime> validateOrderCreationDate(LocalDateTime date)
      Validate order creation date against bounds lowerOrderCreationDate ("Jan 01, 2020 00:00") and upperOrderCreationDate ("Dec 31, 2099 23:59").
      Parameters:
      date - date to validate
      Returns:
      validated date or empty result

    • validateContact

      public Optional<String> validateContact(String contact)
      Validate contact for acceptable email address or phone number and return contact or empty result.
      Rules for validating a email addresses and phone numbers are defined by regular expressions:
      • email address: "^[a-z0-9._%+-]+@[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z0-9_]+$".
      • phone number: "^(phone:|fax:|\\+[0-9]+){0,1}\\s*[\\s0-9()][\\s0-9()-]*".
      • leading and trailing white spaces [\s], commata [,;] and quotes ["'] are trimmed from contacts before validation.
      Parameters:
      contact - contact to validate
      Returns:
      possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) valid contact or empty result

    • validateName

      public Optional<String> validateName(String name, boolean acceptEmptyName)
      Validate name and return name or empty result. A valid name must start with a letter, followed by a combination of letters, "-", "." or white spaces. Valid names are: "E", "E.", "Eric", "Ulla-Nadine", "Eric Meyer", "von-Blumenfeld". Names do not include numbers or other special characters.
      Rules for validating a name are defined by a regular expression:
      • "^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z-\\s.]*$".
      • leading and trailing white spaces [\s], commata [,;] and quotes ["'] are trimmed from names before validation, e.g. " 'Schulz-Müller, Tim Anton' ". 
       Examples:
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
 |name to validate                    |valid, possibly modified name          |
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
 |"Eric"                              |"Eric"                                 |
 |"Ulla-Nadine"                       |"Ulla-Nadine"                          |
 |"E", "E.", "von-A"                  |"E", "E.", "von-A"                     |
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+

 Trim leading, trailing white spaces and quotes:
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
 |"  Anne  "   (lead/trailing spaces) |"Anne"                                 |
 |"  'Meyer'  "   (quotes)            |"Meyer"                                |
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
      Parameters:
      name - name to validate
      acceptEmptyName - accept empty ("") name, e.g. as first name
      Returns:
      valid, possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) name or empty result

    • validateSplitName

      public Optional<DataFactory.NameParts> validateSplitName(String name)
      Split single-String name into first and last name parts and validate parts, e.g. "Meyer, Eric" is split into first: "Eric" and last name: "Meyer".
      Rules of splitting a single-String name into last- and first name parts:
      • if a name contains no seperators (comma or semicolon [,;]), the trailing consecutive part is the last name, all prior parts are first name parts, e.g. "Tim Anton Schulz-Müller", splits into first name: "Tim Anton" and last name: "Schulz-Müller".
      • names with seperators (comma or semicolon [,;]) split into a last name part before the seperator and a first name part after the seperator, e.g. "Schulz-Müller, Tim Anton" splits into first name: "Tim Anton" and last name: "Schulz-Müller".
      • leading and trailing white spaces [\s], commata [,;] and quotes ["'] are trimmed from names before validation, e.g. " 'Schulz-Müller, Tim Anton' ".
      • interim white spaces between name parts are removed, e.g. "Schulz-Müller, <white-spaces> Tim <white-spaces> Anton <white-spaces> ". 
       Examples:
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
 |Single-String name                  |first name parts   |last name parts    |
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
 |"Eric Meyer"                        |"Eric"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Meyer, Anne"                       |"Anne"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Meyer; Anne"                       |"Anne"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Tim Schulz‐Mueller"                |"Tim"              |"Schulz‐Mueller"   |
 |"Nadine Ulla Blumenfeld"            |"Nadine Ulla"      |"Blumenfeld"       |
 |"Nadine‐Ulla Blumenfeld"            |"Nadine‐Ulla"      |"Blumenfeld"       |
 |"Khaled Mohamed Abdelalim"          |"Khaled Mohamed"   |"Abdelalim"        |
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+

 Trim leading, trailing and interim white spaces and quotes:
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
 |" 'Eric Meyer'  "                   |"Eric"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Nadine     Ulla     Blumenfeld"    |"Nadine Ulla"      |"Blumenfeld"       |
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
      Parameters:
      name - single-String name to split into first- and last name parts
      Returns:
      record with valid, possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) first and last name parts or empty result
